Title: A comprehensive review on digital twins for smart energy management system
Authors: Mario Lamagna, D. Groppi, M. M. Nezhad, G. Piras
Venue: International Journal of Energy Production and Management
Abstract summary: This paper reviews the challenges and barriers to adopting digital twins in smart energy systems, but does not specifically discuss limitations of human digital twins in distributed energy resources.

Title: Remote Sensing
Authors: D. Botín-Sanabria, Adriana-Simona Mihaita, Rodrigo E. Peimbert-García, M. A. Ramírez-Moreno, Ricardo A. Ramírez-Mendoza, J. Lozoya-Santos
Venue: IEEE/OES Working Conference on Current Measurement Technology
Abstract summary: This paper provides a general overview of digital twin technology and its implementation challenges, but does not specifically discuss limitations in the context of distributed energy resources.

Title: A review on digital twins for power generation and distribution
Abstract summary: This paper reviews digital twin applications in the power generation and distribution domains, but does not discuss limitations of human digital twins in distributed energy resources.

Title: Smart Energy Network Digital Twins: Findings from a UK-Based Demonstrator Project
Authors: Matthew Deakin, Marta Vanin, Zhong Fan, D. Hertem
Venue: International Journal of Electrical Power & Energy Systems
Abstract summary: This paper discusses the challenges of combining imperfect model and measurement data in developing digital twins for electrical distribution systems.

Title: Digital Twin: Vision, Benefits, Boundaries, and Creation for Buildings
Authors: S. Khajavi, Naser Hossein Motlagh, Alireza Jaribion, L. Werner, J. Holmström
Abstract summary: This paper discusses the benefits and limitations of using digital twins for building life cycle management, but does not mention distributed energy resources.

Title: Human-Focused Digital Twin Applications for Occupational Safety and Health in Workplaces: A Brief Survey and Research Directions
Authors: Jin-Sung Park, Dong-Gu Lee, Jesús A. Jiménez, Sung-Jin Lee, Jun-Woo Kim
Abstract summary: This paper discusses the limitations of building human-focused digital twins for occupational safety and health applications, but does not mention distributed energy resources.

Title: Digital Twin of a Single-Phase Home Converter System Integrating Distributed Energy Resources
Authors: Ashish Patel, Sisir Kumar Yadav, Shubham Tiwary, H. Mathur
Venue: 2023 IEEE International Conference on Energy Technologies for Future Grids (ETFG)
Abstract summary: This paper presents a digital twin of a single-phase home inverter connected to distributed energy resources, but does not discuss limitations of human digital twins.

Title: Microgrid Digital Twin Application for Future Virtual Power Plants
Authors: I. Idrisov, I. Veretennikov, Stepan P. Vasilev, Sebastian Gutierrez, F. M. Ibanez
Venue: Annual Conference of the IEEE Industrial Electronics Society
Abstract summary: The paper proposes using digital twins to address limitations of conventional virtual power plants in integrating distributed energy resources.
